guide.title: dynfw Dynamic Firewall Tools, v1.0
guide.abstract: Firewalls all good and fun, but what do you do when you need to make rapid, complex changes to your iptables-based firewall rules? Easy -- use the dynfw Dynamic Firewall Tools, a collection of robust bash scripts that are designed to work with nearly any existing iptables-based firewall configuration. You can use these scripts to increase your network security and responsiveness, and as inspiration for your own creative designs.

body.p:
The dynfw scripts originated from an article I wrote for IBM developerWorks that showed how to make a firewall more responsive by creating scripts that automate common "firewall-tweaking" tasks, such as blocking an IP, ratelimiting a host, etc. The reason for the scripts is simple -- when you're in a crisis, you don't want to make changes to your master firewall script in a frantic state. Instead, you want to have an already-existing and easy-to-use mechanism to make those changes for you, eliminating the possibility of error and allowing immediate response. The following scripts are included in dynfw-1.0.tar.gz:
You can read the original IBM developerWorks article here, which explains how to use the scripts.
You can download the current version of dynfw here: dynfw-1.0.tar.gz.

ScriptDescription
ipdropdiscard packets coming from a specific IP
ipblockdiscard as above, but send an TCP reset if applicable
tcplimitlimits new connections to a local port to a certain rate (per sec,minute,hour or day)
user-outblockprevents a specific UID (user) from establishing outbound connections
